Query: How can I extract a page range / a part of a PDF?

Answers.MP Summary: Portable Document Format (PDF) to text converter (version 3.03)
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Convert filename.pdf to plain text and save it as filename.txt
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_34625953: Is there any way to get the page numbers in a PDF of a search pattern?
au_1195340: Extract a specific pdf from a zip file with lots of pdfs
Top-3 Scripts:
so_34625953: pdftotext test.pdf - |
awk -vRS=$'\f' -vNAME="My name" \
    'index($0,NAME){printf "%d: %s\n", NR, NAME;}'

pdftotext test.pdf - |
grep -F -o -e $'\f' -e 'My name' |
awk 'BEGIN{page=1} /\f/{++page;next} 1{printf "%d: %s\n", page, $0;}'

pdftotext test.pdf - |
awk -vRS=$'\f' \
    '/My[[:space:]]+Name/{printf "%d: %s\n", NR, "My Name";}'

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_625565: How to extract and/or remove the last page of a bunch of PDFs?
su_372061: How to extract all pages of one big pdf file?
Top-3 Scripts:
su_625565: pdftk input.pdf cat end-1 output temp.pdf
pdftk temp.pdf  cat end-2 output output.pdf
rm temp.pdf

pdftk input.pdf cat 1-$((last-1)) output output.pdf

su_372061: $ sudo apt-get install pdftk

$ pdftk file.pdf burst

Explanations about Options.-j:
junk paths. The archive's directory structure is not recreated; all files are
 deposited in the extraction directory (by default, the current one).
Explanations about Options.-c:
extract files to stdout/screen (``CRT''). This option is similar to the -p option
 except that the name of each file is printed as it is extracted, the -a option is
 allowed, and ASCII-EBCDIC conversion is automatically performed if appropriate.
 This option is not listed in the unzip usage screen.

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_59383: Extract part of a video with a one-line command
Top-3 Scripts:
au_59383: ffmpeg -formats -E

ffmpeg -ss 00:00:30 -i orginalfile -t 00:00:05 -vcodec copy -acodec copy newfile

Explanations about Options.-acodec: Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-t:
When used as an input option (before "-i"), limit the duration of data read from the
 input file.
Explanations about Options.-ss:
When used as an input option (before "-i"), seeks in this input file to position. Note
 that in most formats it is not possible to seek exactly, so ffmpeg will seek to the
 closest seek point before position. When transcoding and -accurate_seek is enabled
 (the default), this extra segment between the seek point and position will be decoded
 and discarded. When doing stream copy or when -noaccurate_seek is used, it will be
 preserved.
Explanations about Options.-vcodec: Set the video codec. This is an alias for "-codec:v".
